definition: to cause to move or send forth by throwing
direct
to put forth, to place as if by throwing
examples: the fire casts a warm glow

definition: to deposit (a ballot) formally
to throw off or away, to get rid of : discard, shed, molt, to bring forth, to give birth to prematurely
examples: soda cans and fast-food boxes cast aside on the beach

definition: to throw to the ground especially in wrestling
examples: The cow was cast and her legs tied.

definition: to build by throwing up earth
to perform arithmetical operations on : add, to calculate by means of astrology
decide, intend
to dispose or arrange into parts or into a suitable form or order
examples: I shall cast what I have to say under two principal heads

definition: to assign the parts of (a dramatic production) to actors, to assign (someone, such as an actor) to a role or part
examples: was cast in the leading role

definition: to give a shape to (a substance) by pouring in liquid or plastic form into a mold and letting harden without pressure
to form by this process
turn
to make (a knot or stitch) by looping or catching up
twist, warp
to transmit the sound and images of (something happening) in real time via the Internet
examples: The event is cast live over the Internet and broadcast later on National Public Radio's "Science Friday."
The webinar will be cast live over Skype on a large screen at the church.

definition: to throw something, to throw out a lure with a fishing rod
vomit
to bear fruit : yield
to perform addition
estimate, conjecture
warp
to range over land in search of a trail
veer
to draw lots to determine a matter by chance
an act of casting
something that happens as a result of chance
a throw of dice
examples: a seven on the first cast

definition: a throw of a line (such as a fishing line) or net
the form in which a thing is constructed
the set of actors in a dramatic production, a set of characters or persons
examples: The show features an all-star cast.
in both great houses there is the usual cast of servants

definition: the arrangement of draperies in a painting
the distance to which a thing can be thrown, the distance a bow can shoot
a turning of the eye in a particular direction, expression
examples: this freakish, elfish cast came into the child's eye

definition: a slight strabismus
something that is thrown or the quantity thrown, the leader of a fishing line

something that is formed by casting in a mold or form: such as, a reproduction (as of a statue) in metal or plaster : casting, a fossil reproduction of the details of a natural object by mineral infiltration
an impression taken from an object with a liquid or plastic substance : mold
examples: They made a mask from a wax cast of her face.

definition: a rigid casing (as of fiberglass or of gauze impregnated with plaster of paris) used for immobilizing a usually diseased or broken part
examples: has a cast on her broken arm

definition: forecast, conjecture
an overspread of a color or modification of the appearance of a substance by a trace of some added hue : shade
tinge, suggestion
examples: a cast of bitterness in his words

definition: a ride on one's way in a vehicle : lift
examples: A motorist gave him a cast as far as the town.

definition: help, assistance
shape, appearance
examples: the delicate cast of her features

definition: characteristic quality
examples: his father's conservative cast of mind

definition: something that is shed, ejected, or thrown out or off: such as
the excrement of an earthworm
a mass of soft matter formed in cavities of diseased organs and discharged from the body
the skin of an insect
the ranging in search of a trail by a dog, hunting pack, or tracker
examples: The setter made a wide cast.
